name: Frank Tip
content: Frank Tip Frank Tip home publications research service contact Frank Tip is a Professor at the Khoury College of Computer Sciences at Northeastern University and an Amazon Scholar at Amazon Web Services. Previously, he was a Senior Principal Engineer at Samsung Research America in Mountain View, California (2014-2016), a Professor and Cheriton Research Chair in the David R. Cheriton School of Computer Science at the University of Waterloo (2012-2014), and a Research Staff Member and Manager at the Software Technology Department at the IBM T.J. Watson Research Center (1995-2012). He received his PhD in 1995 from the University of Amsterdam. Frank's current research interests include: Test Generation using Large Language Models, Securing WebAssembly using Static Analysis and Binary Instrumentation, Asynchronous Programming, Refactoring, Program Optimization, and applications of Static and Dynamic Program Analysis.
